metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20796 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description: In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, check_dst_limits_calc_pos_1 in posix/regexec.c has Uncontrolled Recursion, as demonstrated by '(\227|)(\\1\\1|t1|\\\2537)+' in grep.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> glibc regex compiler is not supposed to be exposed to untrusted content, and upstream does not consider this to be a security issue: https://sourceware.org/glibc/wiki/Security%20Exceptions https://lists.gnu.org/r/bug-gnulib/2018-09/msg00068.html  as of 2020-06-04, no fix available from upstream. We will not be fixing this issue in Ubuntu, marking as ignored.

criterions.comment: glibc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
